alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 8:43PM MDT until June 05 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Clear Creek at Chinook affecting Blaine County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Clear Creek at Chinook. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Water starting to cover Machinist Road and Clear Creek Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM MDT Sunday was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling on Monday. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.7 feet on 07/08/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 600 AM MDT.
